basic.description: This course is an introduction to the study of the earth using photographic and electronic imaging acquired from aircraft and satellites; physics of the interaction between electromagnetic radiation and materials of Earth's surface and hydrosphere; principles of electronic and microwave imaging; and use of digital image analysis and GIS in the study of earth resources and global change.
basic.subject: GLY
basic.title: Introduction to Remote Sensing, Air Photo Interpretation and GIS for the Earth Sciences
